tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. Chinese verbs don't change form, so tense is indicated by time words or context.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am a student
You are a good person
He is Chinese
We are friends
You are students
They are students

tenses.description: Used to describe completed actions in the past. Chinese indicates past tense using time words like '昨天' (yesterday) or aspect markers like '了'.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I used to be a student
You used to be a doctor
He used to be a student
We used to be friends
You used to be students
They used to be students

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Chinese indicates future tense using time words like '明天' (tomorrow) or auxiliary verbs like '会' (will).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will be the new manager tomorrow
You will be the busiest person tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他明天会是团队负责人
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will be the team leader tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我们明天会是合作伙伴
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will be partners tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你们明天会是项目核心
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will be the core of the project tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他们明天会是行业专家
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will be industry experts tomorrow

tenses.description: Used to express ongoing process of becoming. Since '是' (to be) is a stative verb, the progressive form uses '正在成为' (becoming) to indicate an ongoing transformation or change in state.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我正在成为一个更好的人
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am becoming a better person

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你正在成为团队中最重要的成员
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are becoming the most important member of the team

conjugations.exampleSentence: 她正在成为一名优秀的老师
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She is becoming an excellent teacher
We are becoming good friends

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你们正在成为这个项目的核心
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are becoming the core of this project

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他们正在成为行业领导者
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are becoming industry leaders

tenses.description: Used to indicate that an action has been completed and has relevance to the present. The aspect marker '了' is used after the verb to show completion.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am now a doctor (I have become a doctor)
You are an adult now
He has become a manager
We have become good friends
You all are university students now
They have become partners

tenses.description: Used to express that someone has had the experience of being something or doing something in the past. Formed with '过' after the verb.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have been a teacher before
Have you been a class monitor before?
She has been a manager at a company
We have been neighbors before
Have you been classmates before?
They have been competitors

tenses.description: Used to negate statements about being or identity. Chinese uses '不' before the verb '是' to form the negative.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am not a student, I am a teacher

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你不是一个人，我们都在这里
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are not alone, we are all here

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他不是中国人，他是日本人
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He is not Chinese, he is Japanese

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我们不是敌人，我们是朋友
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We are not enemies, we are friends

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你们不是初学者，你们很有经验
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are not beginners, you have a lot of experience
They are not from here

tenses.description: Used to negate past states or experiences. Chinese typically uses '没(有)当过' for experiential negation with roles, or '不是' for simple past negation.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was not a teacher before
You were not a class monitor before
She was not a student before
We were not friends before
You were not classmates before

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他们以前不是合作伙伴
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were not partners before

tenses.description: Used to express ability, possibility, or permission. Chinese uses auxiliary verbs like '能' (can), '会' (can/will), '可以' (can/may) before the main verb.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I can be a good student
You can be a good teacher
He can be a good doctor
We can be good friends
You can be good students
They can be good colleagues

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations or conditions. Chinese uses '如果...就...' (if...then...) or '要是...就...' constructions.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果我是老师，我就会帮助学生
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If I were a teacher, I would help students

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果你是医生，你就会救人
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you were a doctor, you would save people

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果他是老板，他就会管理公司
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If he were a boss, he would manage the company

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果我们是朋友，我们就会互相帮助
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If we were friends, we would help each other

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果你们是学生，你们就会好好学习
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you were students, you would study hard

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果他们是同事，他们就会合作
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If they were colleagues, they would cooperate

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Chinese often uses the verb directly with '要' (must) or '应该' (should) for polite commands.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be a good student!
Be an honest person!
Be a brave person!

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. Chinese verbs don't change form, so tense is indicated by time words or context.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have a book
Do you have books?
She has a cat
We have time
You are right (have reason)
They have a house

tenses.description: Used to describe completed actions in the past. Chinese indicates past tense using time words like '昨天' (yesterday) or aspect markers like '了'.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had a meeting yesterday
You had an exam yesterday
She had a date yesterday
We had an activity yesterday
You had class yesterday
They had a party yesterday

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Chinese indicates future tense using time words like '明天' (tomorrow) or auxiliary verbs like '会' (will).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have time tomorrow
You will have time tomorrow
She will have a cat tomorrow
We will have time tomorrow
You will have opportunities tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他们明天会有一所房子
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have a house tomorrow

tenses.description: Used to express ongoing states or gradual changes in possession. With '有', this describes the process of gaining or experiencing something over time using appropriate aspect markers.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am becoming more and more confident
You are beginning to have a better understanding
She is gradually having new ideas

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我们不断有更多的经验
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We are continuously gaining more experience

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你们慢慢有更好的结果
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are slowly achieving better results
They are continuously making new progress

tenses.description: Used to indicate that an action has been completed with present relevance. The aspect marker '了' shows a change of state or completion.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have (got) a new idea
You have made great progress

conjugations.exampleSentence: 她有了孩子以后变得更成熟了
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has become more mature after having children
We have gained more experience
You have a new plan
They have had great changes

tenses.description: Used to express that someone has had the experience of having or possessing something before. Formed with '过' after the verb.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have had a dog before
Have you had such an experience?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 她有过很多不同的工作
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has had many different jobs
We have had similar ideas

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你们以前有过这样的问题吗
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Have you had such problems before?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他们有过成功的合作经验
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have had successful cooperation experience

tenses.description: Used to negate possession or existence in the present. Chinese uses '没' or '没有' before the verb to form the negative.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我没有钱，但是我有朋友
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I don't have money, but I have friends

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你没有理由担心这件事
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have no reason to worry about this

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他没有经验，但是他很努力
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He doesn't have experience, but he works hard

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我们没有时间浪费在这上面
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We don't have time to waste on this
You have no right to do this
They don't have any problems

tenses.description: Used to negate past possession or experiences. Chinese uses '没' before '有过' for experiential negation.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我以前没有过这样的经历
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have never had such an experience before

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你以前没有过自己的房子吗
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Have you never had your own house before?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 她从来没有过这么好的机会
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has never had such a good opportunity

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我们以前没有过这样的困难
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We have never had such difficulties before

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你们没有过失败的经验吗
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Have you never had the experience of failure?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 他们从来没有过这种想法
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have never had such an idea

tenses.description: Used to express ability, possibility, or permission. Chinese uses auxiliary verbs like '能' (can), '会' (can/will), '可以' (can/may) before the main verb.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I can have more time to study

conjugations.exampleSentence: 你能有一个美好的未来
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You can have a bright future
He can have many opportunities

conjugations.exampleSentence: 我们能有一个更好的计划
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We can have a better plan
You can have more experience
They can have a better life

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations or conditions. Chinese uses '如果...就...' (if...then...) or '要是...就...' constructions.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果我有时间，我就会帮你
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If I have time, I will help you

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果你有机会，你就会成功
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you have the opportunity, you will succeed

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果他有钱，他就会买房子
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If he has money, he will buy a house

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果我们有资源，我们就会开始项目
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If we have resources, we will start the project

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果你们有疑问，你们就可以问
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you have questions, you can ask

conjugations.exampleSentence: 如果他们有支持，他们就会成功
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If they have support, they will succeed

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Chinese often uses the verb directly with '要' (must) or '应该' (should) for polite commands.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Have confidence!
Have patience!
Have a sense of responsibility!
